segment.source: The Payout summary shows you details about the money you’ve earned with your apps and in-app products.
segment.target: The Payout summary shows you details about the money you’ve earned with your apps and in-app products.

segment.source: It also lets you know when you’ll receive payments and how much you'll be paid.
segment.target: It also lets you know when you’ll receive payments and how much you'll be paid.

segment.source: Payout summary
segment.target: Payout summary

segment.source: Payout summary
segment.target: Payout summary

segment.source: The Payout summary shows you details about the money you’ve earned with your apps and in-app products.
segment.target: The Payout summary shows you details about the money you’ve earned with your apps and in-app products.

segment.source: It also lets you know when you’ll receive payments and how much you'll be paid.
segment.target: It also lets you know when you’ll receive payments and how much you'll be paid.

segment.source: If you use Microsoft Advertising to earn money, and your pubCenter and Dev Center accounts are linked, you'll also see payment info for advertising proceeds in the Payout summary.
segment.target: If you use Microsoft Advertising to earn money, and your pubCenter and Dev Center accounts are linked, you'll also see payment info for advertising proceeds in the Payout summary.

segment.source: For more details regarding Advertising Payment policies, see the pubCenter Payment policies.
segment.target: For more details regarding Advertising Payment policies, see the pubCenter Payment policies.

segment.source: If you sell products in the Azure Marketplace, you’ll also see info on successful payouts from November 1, 2015 and forward in the Payout summary.
segment.target: If you sell products in the Azure Marketplace, you’ll also see info on successful payouts from November 1, 2015 and forward in the Payout summary.

segment.source: For more details regarding Azure Marketplace payment, see the Microsoft Azure Marketplace Participation Policies and the Microsoft Azure Marketplace Publisher Agreement.
segment.target: For more details regarding Azure Marketplace payment, see the Microsoft Azure Marketplace Participation Policies and the Microsoft Azure Marketplace Publisher Agreement.

segment.source: More info about viewing earlier Azure Marketplace payout info can be found here.
segment.target: More info about viewing earlier Azure Marketplace payout info can be found here.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To be eligible for payout, your app proceeds must reach the applicable payment threshold.
segment.target: To be eligible for payout, your app proceeds must reach the applicable payment threshold.

segment.source: If the proceeds are less than the payment threshold, they will remain in the Reserved category until the threshold has been met.
segment.target: If the proceeds are less than the payment threshold, they will remain in the Reserved category until the threshold has been met.

segment.source: For more details, see the App Developer Agreement.
segment.target: For more details, see the App Developer Agreement.

segment.source: Current proceeds and payments
segment.target: Current proceeds and payments

segment.source: Near the top of the page, you’ll find your Current proceeds and payments, which contains three sections: Reserved, Upcoming payment, and Most recent payment.
segment.target: Near the top of the page, you’ll find your Current proceeds and payments, which contains three sections: Reserved, Upcoming payment, and Most recent payment.

segment.source: Reserved shows the amount of money your account has accumulated but which has not yet been scheduled for payment, including advertising proceeds.
segment.target: Reserved shows the amount of money your account has accumulated but which has not yet been scheduled for payment, including advertising proceeds.

segment.source: (Azure Marketplace proceeds do not appear in the Reserved section; if you only participate in the Azure Marketplace, you will see $0.00 here.) Proceeds from your most recent advertising and app sales remain on hold for about 30 days before they become eligible for payout.
segment.target: (Azure Marketplace proceeds do not appear in the Reserved section; if you only participate in the Azure Marketplace, you will see $0.00 here.) Proceeds from your most recent advertising and app sales remain on hold for about 30 days before they become eligible for payout.

segment.source: After that, the proceeds will be scheduled for payment the following month (assuming the payment threshold has been met).
segment.target: After that, the proceeds will be scheduled for payment the following month (assuming the payment threshold has been met).

segment.source: When a payment is attempted, your reserved balance will decrease by the payment amount and you will see the amount reflected in Upcoming payment.
segment.target: When a payment is attempted, your reserved balance will decrease by the payment amount and you will see the amount reflected in Upcoming payment.

segment.source: Note that the amount shown in Reserved is an estimate, because exchange rates for sales in other currencies may fluctuate prior to payment creation.
segment.target: Note that the amount shown in Reserved is an estimate, because exchange rates for sales in other currencies may fluctuate prior to payment creation.

segment.source: You may notice your reserved balance change slightly at the beginning of every month.
segment.target: You may notice your reserved balance change slightly at the beginning of every month.

segment.source: Your reserved balance is updated monthly to reflect monthly exchange rates, so that it represents a more accurate estimate.
segment.target: Your reserved balance is updated monthly to reflect monthly exchange rates, so that it represents a more accurate estimate.

segment.source: You can click View details to see additional information, or click the link to Download your reserved transactions to view a .csv file of all your Reserved transactions.
segment.target: You can click View details to see additional information, or click the link to Download your reserved transactions to view a .csv file of all your Reserved transactions.

segment.source: Upcoming payment shows the number of upcoming payments, the amount of your next payment(s), and the payment creation date(s).
segment.target: Upcoming payment shows the number of upcoming payments, the amount of your next payment(s), and the payment creation date(s).

segment.source: If your eligible proceeds haven’t met the payment threshold yet, no upcoming payment will be shown here.
segment.target: If your eligible proceeds haven’t met the payment threshold yet, no upcoming payment will be shown here.

segment.source: You can click View details to see additional information, including the payment amount(s) and their respective revenue source.
segment.target: You can click View details to see additional information, including the payment amount(s) and their respective revenue source.

segment.source: Most recent payment shows the amount of the last payment attempted.
segment.target: Most recent payment shows the amount of the last payment attempted.

segment.source: If the payment was successful, the View details link will be blue, and you can click it to see the details for each payment.
segment.target: If the payment was successful, the View details link will be blue, and you can click it to see the details for each payment.

segment.source: Note that if we attempted to make multiple payments and only one of them was successful, only the amount of the successful payment will be shown here.
segment.target: Note that if we attempted to make multiple payments and only one of them was successful, only the amount of the successful payment will be shown here.

segment.source: If one or more payments failed, the View details link will be red and the number of failed payments will be displayed.
segment.target: If one or more payments failed, the View details link will be red and the number of failed payments will be displayed.

segment.source: You can click View details to see more details about the problem so that you can remedy the situation.
segment.target: You can click View details to see more details about the problem so that you can remedy the situation.

segment.source: Proceeds by app and adjustments
segment.target: Proceeds by app and adjustments

segment.source: This section breaks down the summary info to let you see specifics by app.
segment.target: This section breaks down the summary info to let you see specifics by app.

segment.source: If you earned money through Microsoft Advertising, the total amount of your advertising proceeds is shown here as a single line item.
segment.target: If you earned money through Microsoft Advertising, the total amount of your advertising proceeds is shown here as a single line item.

segment.source: By reviewing this section, you can determine which apps have earned money that’s currently in the Reserved or Most recent payment category.
segment.target: By reviewing this section, you can determine which apps have earned money that’s currently in the Reserved or Most recent payment category.

segment.source: You can also see the total amount you’ve received for each app.
segment.target: You can also see the total amount you’ve received for each app.

segment.source: If it was necessary to make any adjustments to your account balance, you can view them here too.
segment.target: If it was necessary to make any adjustments to your account balance, you can view them here too.

segment.source: (Note that adjustments for Microsoft Advertising proceeds are not currently shown here.)
segment.target: (Note that adjustments for Microsoft Advertising proceeds are not currently shown here.)

segment.source: Payment statements
segment.target: Payment statements

segment.source: In this section you can view statements for all successful monthly payments and see the total amount of money you've been paid.
segment.target: In this section you can view statements for all successful monthly payments and see the total amount of money you've been paid.

segment.source: The Total paid to date section shows the total amount you've been paid for all your sales.
segment.target: The Total paid to date section shows the total amount you've been paid for all your sales.

segment.source: Click View details to see the amounts that came from each revenue source.
segment.target: Click View details to see the amounts that came from each revenue source.

segment.source: Below the Total paid to date section, you will see your last three statements by default.
segment.target: Below the Total paid to date section, you will see your last three statements by default.

segment.source: To see the full statement (for successful payments), click View.
segment.target: To see the full statement (for successful payments), click View.

segment.source: You can access your historical payment statements through the drop-down box.
segment.target: You can access your historical payment statements through the drop-down box.

segment.source: At the top of each statement, you’ll see the total amount of your monthly payment.
segment.target: At the top of each statement, you’ll see the total amount of your monthly payment.

segment.source: Immediately below, in Payments issued, you’ll see a summary of how your payment amount was calculated.
segment.target: Immediately below, in Payments issued, you’ll see a summary of how your payment amount was calculated.

segment.source: Underneath, in the Proceeds breakdown section, you can view details on how much money was made per market and per revenue source (such as Windows Phone Store, Windows Store 8, Windows Store, etc.) by app.
segment.target: Underneath, in the Proceeds breakdown section, you can view details on how much money was made per market and per revenue source (such as Windows Phone Store, Windows Store 8, Windows Store, etc.) by app.

segment.source: You’ll also see details on any adjustments that were made, including the date, amount, and reason for the adjustment.
segment.target: You’ll also see details on any adjustments that were made, including the date, amount, and reason for the adjustment.

segment.source: Note that the sections mentioned above only show info on your proceeds (and adjustments) from app sales; if you earned money through advertising, you’ll see a separate Microsoft Advertising section with details about the payouts and currency conversions.
segment.target: Note that the sections mentioned above only show info on your proceeds (and adjustments) from app sales; if you earned money through advertising, you’ll see a separate Microsoft Advertising section with details about the payouts and currency conversions.

segment.source: Adjustments
segment.target: Adjustments

segment.source: Adjustment category
segment.target: Adjustment category

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Compensatory adjustment
segment.target: Compensatory adjustment

segment.source: Any adjustment made to your payout balance that does not pertain to the other adjustment categories listed
segment.target: Any adjustment made to your payout balance that does not pertain to the other adjustment categories listed

segment.source: Historic balance
segment.target: Historic balance

segment.source: Payout balances from a historic payment system
segment.target: Payout balances from a historic payment system

segment.source: Passin tax
segment.target: Passin tax

segment.source: Tax adjustment related to sales in Korea
segment.target: Tax adjustment related to sales in Korea

segment.source: Downloading payment transactions
segment.target: Downloading payment transactions

segment.source: At the top of each statement, you’ll see a link to Download transactions.
segment.target: At the top of each statement, you’ll see a link to Download transactions.

segment.source: Click this link to get a .csv file with detailed info about each of the transactions included in your payment.
segment.target: Click this link to get a .csv file with detailed info about each of the transactions included in your payment.

segment.source: The following table describes the fields that appear in the .csv file.
segment.target: The following table describes the fields that appear in the .csv file.

segment.source: Note that the exact fields you see may vary as we continue to update our reporting.
segment.target: Note that the exact fields you see may vary as we continue to update our reporting.

segment.source: Field name
segment.target: Field name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Revenue Source
segment.target: Revenue Source

segment.source: The source of your revenue, based on where the transaction occurred (such as Windows Phone Store, Windows Store 8, Windows Store, etc.)
segment.target: The source of your revenue, based on where the transaction occurred (such as Windows Phone Store, Windows Store 8, Windows Store, etc.)

segment.source: Transaction ID
segment.target: Transaction ID

segment.source: Unique transaction identifier
segment.target: Unique transaction identifier

segment.source: Transaction Date Time
segment.target: Transaction Date Time

segment.source: The date and time the transaction occurred (UTC)
segment.target: The date and time the transaction occurred (UTC)

segment.source: Parent Product ID
segment.target: Parent Product ID

segment.source: Unique parent product identifier.
segment.target: Unique parent product identifier.

segment.source: Please note: if there isn’t a parent product for the transaction, then Parent Product ID = Product ID.
segment.target: Please note: if there isn’t a parent product for the transaction, then Parent Product ID = Product ID.

segment.source: Product ID
segment.target: Product ID

segment.source: Unique product identifier
segment.target: Unique product identifier

segment.source: Parent Product Name
segment.target: Parent Product Name

segment.source: Name of the parent product.
segment.target: Name of the parent product.

segment.source: Please note: if there isn’t a parent product for the transaction, then Parent Product Name = Product Name.
segment.target: Please note: if there isn’t a parent product for the transaction, then Parent Product Name = Product Name.

segment.source: Product Name
segment.target: Product Name

segment.source: Name of the product
segment.target: Name of the product

segment.source: Product Type
segment.target: Product Type

segment.source: Type of product (such as App, In-App, Game, etc.)
segment.target: Type of product (such as App, In-App, Game, etc.)

segment.source: Transaction Type
segment.target: Transaction Type

segment.source: Type of transaction (such as purchase, refund, reversal, chargeback, etc.)
segment.target: Type of transaction (such as purchase, refund, reversal, chargeback, etc.)

segment.source: Payment Method
segment.target: Payment Method

segment.source: Customer payment instrument used for the transaction (such as credit card, mobile operator, etc,)
segment.target: Customer payment instrument used for the transaction (such as credit card, mobile operator, etc,)

segment.source: Country / Region
segment.target: Country / Region

segment.source: Country/region where the transaction occurred
segment.target: Country/region where the transaction occurred

segment.source: Local Provider / Seller
segment.target: Local Provider / Seller

segment.source: Local provider/seller of record
segment.target: Local provider/seller of record

segment.source: Transaction Currency
segment.target: Transaction Currency

segment.source: Currency of the transaction
segment.target: Currency of the transaction

segment.source: Transaction Amount
segment.target: Transaction Amount

segment.source: Amount of the transaction
segment.target: Amount of the transaction

segment.source: Tax Remitted
segment.target: Tax Remitted

segment.source: Amount of tax remitted (sales, use, or VAT/GST taxes)
segment.target: Amount of tax remitted (sales, use, or VAT/GST taxes)

segment.source: Net Receipts
segment.target: Net Receipts

segment.source: Transaction amount less tax remitted
segment.target: Transaction amount less tax remitted

segment.source: Store Fee
segment.target: Store Fee

segment.source: The percentage of Net Receipts retained by Microsoft as a fee for making the app or in-app product available in the Store
segment.target: The percentage of Net Receipts retained by Microsoft as a fee for making the app or in-app product available in the Store

segment.source: App Proceeds
segment.target: App Proceeds

segment.source: Net receipts minus the Store Fee
segment.target: Net receipts minus the Store Fee

segment.source: Taxes Withheld
segment.target: Taxes Withheld

segment.source: Amount of income tax withheld
segment.target: Amount of income tax withheld

segment.source: Payment
segment.target: Payment

segment.source: App Proceeds less any applicable income tax withholding (amount shown in Transaction Currency)
segment.target: App Proceeds less any applicable income tax withholding (amount shown in Transaction Currency)

segment.source: FX Rate
segment.target: FX Rate

segment.source: Foreign exchange rate used to convert Transaction Currency to Payment Currency
segment.target: Foreign exchange rate used to convert Transaction Currency to Payment Currency

segment.source: Payment Currency
segment.target: Payment Currency

segment.source: Currency your payment is made in
segment.target: Currency your payment is made in

segment.source: Converted Payment
segment.target: Converted Payment

segment.source: Payment amount converted to Payment Currency using the FX Rate
segment.target: Payment amount converted to Payment Currency using the FX Rate

segment.source: Tax Remit Model
segment.target: Tax Remit Model

segment.source: Party responsible for remitting taxes (sales, use, or VAT/GST taxes)
segment.target: Party responsible for remitting taxes (sales, use, or VAT/GST taxes)

segment.source: Charges
segment.target: Charges

segment.source: Shows a breakdown of all the charge details aggregated in the Transaction Amount column.
segment.target: Shows a breakdown of all the charge details aggregated in the Transaction Amount column.

segment.source: (Only included for Azure Marketplace.)
segment.target: (Only included for Azure Marketplace.)
